intro: Gibbaeum helmiae, commonly known as the helmeted rockrose, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its dense, fleshy foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are often pink or red, and they bloom in late spring or early summer. Gibbaeum helmiae is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its ornamental value and low maintenance requirements.
